name: CVE-2022-0031
description: A local privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XSOAR engine software running on a Linux operating system allows a local attacker with shell access to the engine to execute programs with elevated privileges.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.8.0:3261002:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.6.0:2585049:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.6.0:2889656:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.6.0:3049220:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.6.0:3124193:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.5.0:2102531:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.5.0:2410815:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:paloaltonetworks:cortex_xsoar:6.5.0:2583817:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:linux:linux_kernel:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
